intro: Memecylon campongum, commonly known as the swamp memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, drupaceous fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
